title: Official Blind Review #2
review_assessment:_thoroughness_in_paper: I read the paper at least twice and used my best judgement in assessing the paper.
review:
This paper addresses the super-resolution problem. The key is to use pixel co-occurrence-based loss metric. The idea is very straightforward. But the description could be clearer. For example, what is the spatial size of P (\bar P)? How does it influence the optimization?

Equation (2): There are four loss functions on the right hand. How are the loss defined?

How is the GAN used?

In experiments, there is no evidence showing the benefit from the pixel Co-occurrence

There is a lack of much details. Given the current presentation, I cannot judge if the quality reaches the ICLR bar.
